player: Mike Dunleavy said he expects to play on Friday vs. the Celtics.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play Tuesday vs. the Nets.
Isaiah Whitehead (knee) is questionable for Friday's game vs. Toronto.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) will not play Friday night in Toronto.
Like his teammate Amir Johnson, Jaylen Brown (sprained ankle) will "try to play" Friday night in Atlanta.
Amir Johnson (ankle) will "try to play" on Friday night vs. the Hawks.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) will not play Friday night, but did text coach Brad Stevens Friday morning to tell him he is "feeling a lot better."
James Young didn't travel with the Celtics for for Friday's game against the Hawks
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not play on Friday vs. the Hawks.
Jeremy Lamb (foot) will not play on Friday against the 76ers
Cody Zeller (illness) returned to practice on Thursday.
Nicolas Batum (knee) will play and start Friday vs. the Sixers.
Denzel Valentine (flu) will not play Thursday against the Knicks.
Nikola Mirotic (illness) will not play against the Knicks on Thursday.
Jimmy Butler (illness) is feeling better and is targeting Saturday's game vs. the Pelicans.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Andrew Bogut (right hamstring strain) will not play against the Suns in Mexico City on Thursday.
Darrell Arthur (leg) will not play against the Pacers on Thursday.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Reggie Bullock (personal) is unlikely to play on Friday against the Jazz.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope (left shoulder) has a Grade-2 left rotator cuff strain and will not play on Friday against the Jazz.
Jon Leuer (right knee) will miss the next four games for the Pistons.
Eric Gordon has been cleared to play Friday against Memphis, but said he still wants to give it one more test before the game to be sure.
Clint Capela (leg) said he's feeling good and he remains on pace to return in the next week or two.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) will not play on Thursday vs. the Nuggets.
Coach Doc Rivers said Blake Griffin (knee) feels great and his 4-6 week timetable is still accurate.
Brice Johnson (back) will not play opening night.
Marcelo Huertas (flu-like symptoms) did not practice on Friday.
The Lakers expect Larry Nance (knee) to return in about two weeks.
Deyonta Davis (foot) will be active and available to play Wednesday vs. the Thunder.
Brandan Wright (left ankle) has started full-speed individual workouts and hopes to make his season debut in January.
Willie Reed (bruised sternum) will not play in Friday's game against the Bucks.
Udonis Haslem will play on Tuesday.
Josh Richardson (sprained left foot) will his third consecutive game on Friday, but is "getting better" according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Zach LaVine (hip) said "I don't know" when he asked after shootaround if he would play Friday night vs. OKC.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Rashad Vaughn (ankle) is available to play Tuesday vs. the Spurs.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Anthony Davis (hip) said there is a "high probability" that he will play Saturday against the Bulls.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Coach Jeff Hornacek said Kristaps Porzingis (Achilles) probably will be held out of practice on Friday and Saturday.
Serge Ibaka (shoulder) went through 3-on-3 drills and should be able to play on Friday against the Blazers.
Richaun Holmes was a healthy DNP-CD vs. the Knicks on Wednesday.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Ben Simmons (foot) played point guard during some 5-on-0 drills at Tuesday's practice.
Festus Ezeli (knee) is likely to undergo season-ending surgery.
Matt Barnes will rest on Tuesday vs. Detroit.
Patrick Patterson (knee) did not practice on Thursday.
Delon Wright (shoulder) has been cleared for team practice.
Jared Sullinger (foot) has been cleared for practice.
John Wall spent the end of practice taking free throws to keep his right pinkie away from his shooting motion.
Tomas Satoransky (illness) practiced on Friday with the Wizards.
Scott Brooks said that Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be re-evaluated at the end of January.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated in 10 days.
